alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 9:35PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cabarrus County, North Carolina along Coddle Creek and Irish Buffalo Creek from Kannapolis to Pharr Mill and Rocky River from Harrisburg to Georgeville. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, greenways, parks, boat-access areas, golf courses, low-water crossings, and low-lying roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 PM EDT, Coddle Creek, Irish Buffalo Creek, and Rocky River remain elevated following earlier torrential rainfall, which produced 2-4 inches of rainfall in 2-3 hours across northern Cabarrus County and southern Rowan County. Storm- total rainfall since yesterday has reached 4-6 inches with isolated totals approaching 7 inches in this area. This has caused Coddle Creek, Irish Buffalo Creek, and Rocky River to exceed Action/Advisory Stage, causing nuisance to minor flooding of adjacent low-lying areas. The streamgauge on Coddle Creek near Davidson crested at 15.02 feet at 7:45pm. Action/Advisory Stage is 12.5 feet. Coddle Creek is currently falling steadily. At 13.5 feet floodwaters are impacting low-lying areas near Archer Bridge Rd. Coddle Creek is expected to fall below Action/Advisory Stage during the overnight hours. The streamgauge on Rocky River between Pharr Mill and Georgeville is at 14.85 feet and is rising steadily. At these levels Rocky River is flooding primarily adjacent low- lying areas including farmland and woodland. Nuisance flooding at Pharr Mill Park is also likely. Backwater effects may be impacting Pharr Mill Rd. Action/Advisory Stage is 12.0 feet. Minor Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Rocky River is expected to crest below 16.0 feet overnight tonight and slowly fall below Action/Advisory Stage later tomorrow. - Some locations that may continue to experience flooding include... Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg, and Enochville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
